byline.contributor: Shaila Dewan contributed reporting from New York, and Mitch Smith and Manny Fernandez from Ferguson.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and ELI YOKLEY

abstract: Shooting of two police officers during protest in Ferguson, Mo, threatens resurgence of anger and racial tension just as city seemed to be moving past institutional abuses and public unrest related to death of Michael Brown; incident has alienated some moderates from protest movement they had strongly supported; authorities in city have vowed to increase security.
lead_paragraph: Just as Ferguson, Mo., seemed to be moving past the stunning abuses detailed by the Justice Department, four gunshots on Thursday threatened to rekindle tensions.

headline.main: Just as Ferguson Was Making Progress, Shooting Deals a Setback
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Shots Are a Setback in Its Progress

snippet: Just as Ferguson, Mo., seemed to be moving past the stunning abuses detailed by the Justice Department, four gunshots on Thursday threatened to rekindle tensions.
